comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Try to instantiate a Mozilla style browser - browser = new Browser(parent, SWT.MOZILLA);
2. Having installed xulrunner 1.8.1.3, set / unset MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME and org.eclipse.swt.browser.XULRunnerPath set to the root of the xulrunner directory
3. Get:Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-xulrunner-gtk-3346 or swt-xulrunner-gtk in swt.library.path,
java.library.path or the jar file
        at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:219)
        at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:151)
        at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Mozilla.create(Mozilla.java:244)
        ... 57 more




More information:
Indeed I can't find swt-xulrunner-gtk-3346 or swt-xulrunner-gtk in any swt or rcp release, only perhaps in CVS...
It should be in your plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk...jar file, no?

Ok, appologies:

# jar tvf org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.x86_3.3.0.v3346.jar|grep xulrunner
57912 Mon Jun 25 00:20:56 BST 2007 libswt-xulrunner-gtk-3346.so

Let me try as per our private email correspondance:

Grant wrote:

Since you're running on linux a basic case you can try first is:
- don't set MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME or org.eclipse.swt.browser.XULRunnerPath
- create the Browser with style SWT.NONE
- add Device.DEBUG=true; to your app before the first Browser instance gets instantiated

This prints to stdout the native renderer that a default-style Browser uses, and if you have xulrunner properly installed then it _should_ just be found.  If it finds your xulrunner but fails to be able to use it for some reason then it should print a line indicating this.

Another thing to check is your /etc/gre.d directory for a file that looks something like 1.8.1.3_0000000000.conf.  If it's not there then your xulrunner is likely not registered.  To register it run xulrunner --register-global .

A last thing to try is to put a breakpoint at the top of Mozilla.create(...) and follow its efforts to find a native renderer to use.  (steps for retrieving swt into your workspace from cvs: http://www.eclipse.org/swt/cvs.php )
Closing, the problem was a missing dependency on libstdc++.so.6.

traces.message: no swt-xulrunner-gtk-3346 or swt-xulrunner-gtk in swt.library.path, java.library.path or the jar file
